review_title: Nice People, Low Pay, Bad HR, Slow-moving, Recent Acquisition
job_title: Application Analyst II in Owensboro, KY
pros: People are nice. Fairly laid back culture. They will hire and train from no experience which may be good for some job searchers interested in Epic work. Good work life balance. May change with the transition to Optum.
cons: Hiring team is a joke - very slow moving and unrealistic with timelines. Poor communication to their internal team regarding changes and initiatives - moving team to remote work, market analysis, hiring new employees, etc. Multiple prospective employees and new employees report a bad recruitment experience. Pay below market rate. Entire IT team was recently acquired by Optum. Leadership was excited because this means increasing pay to market rate. Raises were a joke. 2022-2023 IT is losing employees every other week due to low pay.

review_title: It’s not what you know, but who...
pros: It’s difficult to find kind words for this organization. They fire people for no reason other than to say after a few weeks “You’re not going to fit in here.”
cons: Honestly, after 20 years of healthcare service, I would not recommend working for this organization.  Management needs to have a better understanding and concern for their staff.  Management expects to be able to harass their employees without question. Demotions come often and management expects the staff to somehow be okay with that.  And so management continues to enforce bad management on staff, over and over again. So unless you’re a provider that is willing to accept responsibility of other staff members and your pay check suffers for it, I would look elsewhere for employment. Not a good place to work. They will tell you about how pretty their building is and how great it is to work there. But be prepared to see that their promises are hallow and they enjoy telling you about the wonderful opportunities you “could” have working at Owensboro Health. But be prepared to wait and wait, hoping for that opportunity to somehow magically appear.

pros: A very Great place to work

pros: Work every third weekend on most Med/Surg units, and two Mondays and two Fridays a month.
cons: No real compensation for employees who stay long term.  Often, employees will leave after a few years and come back a year later to make more money.  New graduate pay has been raised to the point that an employee who has been here 10 years makes the same as a new graduate nurse.   The hospital emphasizes better than expected patient care, but does very little to improve employee satisfaction.  Management does not support it's employees.  Employees feel like they are constantly defending themselves to keep their job.  The new hospital is nice to look at but is not nurse friendly.  Nurses walk twice as much now as opposed to the old hospital that had a centralized nurse's station.

review_title: Overall a great place to work considering their are not a lot of large employers in the area.
pros: Upper management strives to implement positive culture throughout the entire organization.  OMHS also has a positive image in the community.
cons: Not a lot of jobs available, especially administrative jobs.  If you are wanting to work your way up the later, prepare to wait a while.  I was not impressed with a lot of management.  I think a lot of people are promoted within the company because people know each other.  Owensboro is that type of town...it's all about who you know.

pros: The people and facilities are beautiful and well kept. For he most part people are flexible with family emergencies and issues.
cons: Strict hours, absolutely no overtime. I know for a fact everyone plays favorites, it's an extremely difficult place to get a job at seeing as competition is high. They lead you on about a job when in reality they trashed your application. Communication with staff is often difficult because everything is "kept secret" unless you work in a certain department. I honestly feel terrible for the employees, I wish they knew exactly was going on! :(

pros: People for the most part a very nice.  the hospital is the nicest in the country, all brand new, very clean.  The doctors are for the most part very nice as well.
cons: health insurance is getting pretty bad.  Everything was free a few years back.  Now its a giant chunk of my pay check and the deductible is very high.  Drug card maybe the worst out there.

pros: Most nurses in the ICU are top notch.
cons: Management does not care about patient safety.  1:3 ratios everyday in ICU.  The ICU is staffed by numbers and not acuity.  If there is a 1:1 patient then another nurse is required to take an extra patient while nurses are home "on call".  Nursing staff is burned out from the overload of patients.  They can't keep staff.  New staff leave before their orientation is complete.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Powderly, KY
pros: People you work with easily become family
cons: Management is not up to par. If you come to them with a problem they shoot you down and sweep it under the rug. They tell you that animosity is in the way from them believing what you have to say about concerns with patient's and accounts.

job_title: Human Resource Assistant in Owensboro, KY
pros: I have been with the organization in some capacity for over two years and I can't imagine working anywhere else! It has been a great experience. The organization cares about its employees and it shows daily. My coworkers make the work environment very positive and I am very thankful to work here.
cons: If I were to say a negative about the organization it would be the difficulty it sometimes is to share information throughout the organization. With it being so large sometimes information gets missed by some employees.

pros: Great place to work.  I feel like I make a difference in others lives.  Senior leaders have to make tough decisions but always have the employees best interest in mind.  Healthcare organizations in general are in a tough position right now but Owensboro Health is making  changes to remain a viable organization for the community and the people they serve,  Major employer in the area.  Lots of great people to work with.
cons: Healthcare is a tough industry.

pros: I have been employed by Owensboro Health for nearly 10 years and have been afforded to opportunity to grow within the organization. I started as an intern, progressed to a staff member and now serve as a supervisor.
cons: As with any organization, we still have opportunities to improve processes throughout the organization to become more efficient and provide better quality care.

review_title: one of the best places to work in the country
pros: on the move building a brand new hospital all equipment and everything is brand new.
cons: very busy, lots of changes EMR is just one of over 6 new computer programs all at once.

Positive work environment
Company encourages cultural diversity

Company offers group discounts at businesses

OH gives back to the community
